title: New York DMV Driver (D) Practice Test

test.question: You may cross a single solid white line in the highway:
test.C: C. Only to turn into a driveway
test.D: D. Only to make a u-turn

test.question: As you near an intersection, the traffic light changes from green to yellow.  Your best action would be to:
test.A: A. Speed up to beat the red light
test.B: B. Apply the brakes sharply to stop
test.C: C. Be prepared to stop in the center of the intersection
test.D: D. Be prepared to stop before the intersection

test.question: Which of the following must you obey over the other three?
You may cross a double solid yellow line:
test.A: A. To pass a slow moving truck
test.B: B. To turn into a driveway
test.C: C. To pass a car if traffic permits

test.question: You may not cross a single broken white (or yellow) line:
test.A: A. When to do so would interfere with traffic
test.B: B. When turning left into a driveway
test.C: C. When the car in front is disabled
test.D: D. When passing to the right on a one-way street

test.question: What are the colors of a sign which tells you the distance to the next exit of a highway?
A traffic light which has a green arrow and a red light means that:
test.A: A. You may only drive straight ahead
test.B: B. You may drive only in the direction of the green arrow
test.C: C. You must wait for a green light
test.D: D. Vehicles moving in any direction must stop

test.question: What are the colors of the warning signs that indicate hazards ahead, such as curves in the road or narrow bridges?
test.A: A. Black letters or symbols on a white background
test.B: B. Black letters or symbols on a yellow background
test.C: C. White letters or symbols on a blue background
test.D: D. White letters or symbols on a green background

test.question: You come to an intersection which has a flashing red light.  You should:
test.A: A. Come to a full stop, then go when safe to do so
test.B: B. Stop only if cars are approaching the intersection
test.C: C. Stop only if cars are already in the intersection
test.D: D. Slow down and be prepared to stop if necessary

test.question: An intersection has a stop sign and a crosswalk, but no stop line.  You must stop:
test.C: C. Where you think the stop line would be
test.D: D. With your front wheels in the crosswalk

test.question: When the road is marked with a solid yellow line and a broken yellow line on your side you may pass:
test.B: B. If you are on an expressway

test.question: What does a flashing yellow light mean?
test.D: D. Come to a full stop

test.question: What does this road sign mean?
test.A: A. Slow down and prepare to stop only if cars are approaching you
test.B: B. Come to a full stop, then go when it is safe to do so
test.C: C. Proceed carefully through the intersection, not always stopping
test.D: D. Stop only for traffic on an intersecting road

test.question: A solid white line on the right edge of the highway slants in toward your left.  This shows that:
test.A: A. There is an intersection just ahead
test.B: B. You are approaching a construction area
test.C: C. You will be required to turn left just ahead
test.D: D. The road will get narrower

test.question: A red and white triangular sign at an intersection means:
test.A: A. Always come to a full stop at the intersection
test.B: B. Slow down and be prepared to stop if necessary
test.C: C. Slow down if an emergency vehicle is approaching
test.D: D. Look both ways as you cross the intersection

test.question: Which of the following is used on some highways to direct drivers into the proper lanes for turning?
test.C: C. White lines on the side of the road
test.D: D. White arrows in the middle of the lanes
